name: aerofly RC 7
description: Learn to fly radio controlled (R/C) models with aerofly RC 7. When it comes to learning and improving R/C flying skills, aerofly RC 7 is the number one choice for R/C pilots. Our state of the art physics simulation gives you a stunning level of realism.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2 / Windows Vista / Windows 7 / Windows 8 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or AMD Athlon64 X2 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 4850 or NVIDIA GeForce 9600 with 512 MB Storage: 20 GB available space Additional Notes: For an optimum flying experience the use of a USB joystick is recommended.
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / Windows 8 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 5770 or NVIDIA GeForce 450 GTS or faster with 1 GB Storage: 20 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Wish I could get a refund. I mistakenly assumed they would have improved their flight model from Pro, but all they did was add aircraft and sceneries. I cannot detect any improvement in stall/snap/spin realism at all. Pretty good for basic stuff, and hovering/torque rolls, but stall/snap performance is MUCH too forgiving, and not at all representative of any but the most forgiving models. Realflight is MUCH MUCH better. I have been flying RC since 1978 and I'm an 8,000 hour professional pilot (full-scale) with competition acro experience (full-scale).
Edit: Figured this out a long time ago, figured i'd change my review. Aerofly RC7 is fun to do stuffs in
